verses.roman:
yāni yānīha rūpāṇi
krīḍanārthaṁ bibharṣi hi
tair āmṛṣṭa-śuco lokā
mudā gāyanti te yaśaḥ

synonyms: yāni yāni—which various; iha—in this material world; rūpāṇi—forms; krīḍana—of play; artham—for the sake; bibharṣi—You manifest; hi—indeed; taiḥ—by them; āmṛṣṭa—cleansed; śucaḥ—of their unhappiness; lokāḥ—people; mudā—joyfully; gāyanti—sing; te—Your; yaśaḥ—glories.
translation: To enjoy Your pastimes You manifest Yourself in various forms in this material world, and these incarnations cleanse away all the unhappiness of those who joyfully chant Your glories.
